decks.notes: This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's plays while ramping up mana to quickly bring out powerful Eldrazi creatures. By utilizing a mix of counter spells, card draw, and ramp spells, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and overwhelm them with massive threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Devourer of Destiny. With the ability to quickly bring out these game-ending creatures, the deck looks to dominate the late game and secure victory through its powerful Eldrazi creatures.

This deck utilizes a powerful combo with Living End to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures and then return them to the battlefield all at once, overwhelming the opponent. It also includes various cards that can manipulate the top of the library, counter spells, and provide card advantage to support the combo. The deck aims to control the game until it can successfully execute the Living End combo and swing the game in its favor with a strong board presence.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Utopia Sprawl, Eldrazi Temple, and Talisman of Impulse to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. It controls the game with board wipes like Malevolent Rumble and removal spells like Kozilek's Command and Kozilek's Return, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Devourer of Destiny and Writhing Chrysalis. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its powerful creatures and disruptive spells while maintaining control of the board.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana to cast multiple spells in a single turn, aiming to combo off with cards like Grapeshot or Ral, Monsoon Mage to deal a high amount of damage to the opponent. It utilizes cards like Desperate Ritual, Pyretic Ritual, and Manamorphose to ramp up mana production, while also including Past in Flames to allow for reusing valuable spells from the graveyard. The deck also includes cards like Glimpse the Impossible and Reckless Impulse to draw through the deck quickly, finding the necessary combo pieces to secure a win.

This deck revolves around using Neoform and Allosaurus Rider to quickly put big creatures onto the battlefield, such as Autochthon Wurm or Griselbrand. Nourishing Shoal allows for quick life gain and card draw, while Eldritch Evolution and Disciple of Freyalise help to tutor for important combo pieces. Pact of Negation provides protection while Summoner's Pact helps to find crucial creatures. The deck also includes a variety of utility cards like Mox Amber and Springleaf Drum to generate mana and keep the combo going. Overall, the deck aims to assemble a powerful board presence quickly and overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on utilizing synergies between Broodscale creatures and various artifacts to create a powerful combo that generates massive value and control over the game. By ramping up with Eldrazi Temple and Urza's Saga, using Blade of the Bloodchief to boost creatures, and disrupting opponents with spells like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of big creatures, removal, and card advantage. Emrakul, the Promised End serves as a finisher, ensuring victory once the combo is fully online.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with low-cost aggressive creatures and efficient burn spells. By utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler, along with pumps like Mutagenic Growth and Violent Urge, the deck aims to control the board and burn the opponent out before they have a chance to stabilize. The deck also includes card draw and scrying effects to ensure consistent aggression and card advantage. With a mana base designed for speed and consistency, this deck is all about fast-paced, relentless aggression.

The deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures with various abilities to create powerful combos and control the game. It utilizes cards like Chord of Calling to search for key creatures, such as Cauldron Familiar and Viscera Seer, to generate value and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of cards like Birthing Ritual and Gilded Goose helps ramp up mana production to cast higher-cost creatures like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by efficiently utilizing its creatures and synergistic interactions.

This deck focuses on quickly building up mana through cheap spells and mana accelerators, eventually casting spells that deal damage directly to the opponent or their creatures. By utilizing cards like Ruby Medallion and rituals, the deck can easily cast powerful spells like Sundering Eruption and Irencrag Feat to finish off the opponent. Blood Moon can disrupt the opponent's mana base, while Goblin Charbelcher provides a powerful win condition. Overall, the deck aims to quickly and efficiently combo off without relying on traditional lands for mana production.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly and efficiently to play powerful land-based combos, primarily utilizing Amulet of Vigor to untap lands and generate extra mana. The key combo involves using Primeval Titan to search for specific lands such as Gruul Turf or Lotus Field, which can generate mana or provide additional effects. The goal is to assemble the necessary pieces to efficiently play cards like Scapeshift and Aftermath Analyst, allowing for explosive plays and overwhelming the opponent with large threats. Overall, the deck aims to quickly set up a board state that can win the game in a single turn.

The deck focuses on controlling the board through removal spells and counter magic while utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to gain card advantage and control the game. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Phlage and Wrath of the Skies to close out the game. The mana base is built to consistently cast all the spells in the deck while also providing access to all necessary colors of mana.
